com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveFileIf

public interface XhiveFileIf

Represents a physical storage location used by the database.

A segment can be spread physically over mutiple files. Such a file is represented by the XhiveFileIf interface. Each segment always has at least one file, the default file. Files can never be deleted without deleting their owner segment. Files can be added programmatically using the X-Hive API.

More information about files and segments can be found in the manual in the chapter Internal structure of X-Hive/DB.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive 3.0
See Also:
for more information on segments and files.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

setMaxFileSize

void setMaxFileSize(long maxFileSize)
Set the maximum number of bytes this file is allowed to contain, where a value of 0 means unlimited. The actual size may become slightly larger, because the limit is only checked when allocating new data pages, not when allocating pages for internal space allocation administration.

Parameters:
maxFileSize - maximum number of bytes this file is allowed to contain.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

getCurrentFileSize

long getCurrentFileSize()
Find the current size of the file in bytes. This may not always equal the size seen using operating system utilities. If space for new data has been allocated to this file, but the new data is still in the server cache and has not been written to disk yet, this method will return a larger value than commands like ls.

Returns:
The current size of this file.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0
